thread.title: Liberty boys soccer edges rival Freedom in back-and-forth game
thread.title_full: Liberty boys soccer edges rival Freedom in back-and-forth game

title: Liberty boys soccer edges rival Freedom in back-and-forth game
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Liberty 2, Freedom 1 – Rapid Recap 
Liberty High School’s boys soccer team survived a serious challenge from rival Freedom , defeating the Patriots 2-1 on Thursday night at Bethlehem Area School District Stadium. 
Turning point : Hurricanes junior Talhah Netherlin latched onto the ball in Freedom territory and played a great feed to classmate Abe Meral . The forward placed a shot into the top of the net, giving Liberty a 2-1 advantage with 15:12 left in the second half. 
Top performer : Meral was the definition of a super-sub for Liberty, providing instant offense during his time on the field. He scored his team’s opener by striking a bouncing ball near the top of the box to give the Hurricanes a 1-0 lead with 13:45 remaining before halftime. 
What it means : Liberty (10-1 overall, 8-1 Eastern Pennsylvania Conference), a winner of five straight and the second-ranked team by lehighvalleylive, keeps rolling. Freedom (9-4, 9-2) still has a lot to look forward to, including another meeting with their rival.
